message.content:
cs.MM, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.CC

The paper deals with the challenge of handling unpopular live-broadcasting channels in Crowdsourced Live Streaming (CLS) systems, which involves measuring and analyzing the resource consumption of broadcasters and proposing a solution for service partitioning on hybrid cloud. This work involves aspects of multimedia (cs.MM) in terms of video ingesting and transcoding, network infrastructure (cs.NI) in terms of providing video services to massive and heterogeneous broadcasters and viewers, distributed and parallel computing (cs.DC) in terms of deploying expensive server clusters and elastic cloud virtual machines, system and control (cs.SY) in terms of smartly assigning tasks to optimize system deployment, and computation and language (cs.CC) in terms of trace-driven evaluation and comprehensive solution design.
